00022 buildFrame<-function(contrast,
00023   size,
00024   len_nsp,
00025   len_sty){
00026 
00027 # Center all variables
00028   len_nsp  <- len_nsp - mean(len_nsp)
00029   len_sty  <- len_sty - mean(len_sty)
00030   contrast <- contrast - mean(contrast)
00031   size     <- size - mean(size)
00032   
00033   myData.full <- data.frame(list(
00034     contrast=contrast,
00035     size=size,
00036     size2=size^2,
00037     size3=size^3,
00038     len_nsp=len_nsp,
00039     len_nsp2=len_nsp^2,
00040     len_nsp3=len_nsp^3,
00041     len_sty=len_sty,
00042     len_sty2=len_sty^2,
00043     len_sty3=len_sty^3,
00044   ))
00045         myData.full
00046 }

00052 EMContrast<-function(myData, max_iterations,
00053   log_lik_convergence
00054 )
00055 {
00056  while (log_lik_diff > log_lik_convergence & n_iterations < max_iterations){
00057     n_iterations <- n_iterations+1
00058     
00059     ## M
00060     fit1 <- lm(myData$contrast~1+size+size2+size3+len_nsp+len_nsp2+len_nsp3+len_sty+len_sty2+len_sty3,weights=z[,1],data=myData)
00061         # none of these covariates are expected to change centering
00062         # any covariates changing centering enter into all terms
00063         # therefore fit2 is only constant
00064         fit2 <- lm(myData$contrast~1,weights=z[,2],data=myData)
00065     fit3 <- lm(myData$contrast~1+size+size2+size3+len_nsp+len_nsp2+len_nsp3+len_sty+len_sty2+len_sty3,weights=z[,3],data=myData)  }
00066 
00067         return(list(
00068     fit1=fit1,
00069     fit2=fit2,
00070     fit3=fit3,
00071         sigma=sigma,
00072     n_iterations=n_iterations,
00073   ))    
00074 }

00076 /*
00077 predictNorm<-function(myData, EMnorm)
00078 {
00079         # predict expected centers for each genotype based on covariates
00080   pred1 <- predict(EMnorm$fit1,newdata=myData.full)
00081   pred2 <- predict(EMnorm$fit2,newdata=myData.full)
00082   pred3 <- predict(EMnorm$fit3,newdata=myData.full)
00083 
00084         # how likely is a given contrast to be a given genotype
00085         # based on expected centers
00086   weights <- matrix(0,length(contrast),3)
00087   weights[,1] <- dnorm(myData$contrast,pred1,EMnorm$sigma[1])
00088   weights[,2] <- dnorm(myData$contrast,pred2,EMnorm$sigma[2])
00089   weights[,3] <- dnorm(myData$contrast,pred3,EMnorm$sigma[3])
00090         # hard shell to prevent crossover
00091   weights[myData$contrast >= pred2, 1] <- 0
00092   weights[myData$contrast <= pred2, 3] <- 0
00093 
00094         # for every SNP
00095         # correct the observed contrast
00096         # by target-expected mean conditional on genotype
00097         # averaged over the probability of a given genotype for that SNP
00098         # based on the expected mean for that genotype
00099   contrast.new <- myData$contrast + apply((matrix(rep(targetHomContrast*c(-1,0,1),rep(nSNP,3)),ncol=3)- cbind(pred1,pred2,pred3)) * sweep(weights,1,rowSums(weights),"/"),1,sum)
00100         contrast.new
00101 }*/
00102 
00103 normalizeContrastE <- function(
00104   contrast,
00105   size,
00106   len_nsp,
00107   len_sty,
00108   max_iterations=50,
00109   log_lik_convergence=20,
00110   nSubset=5000,
00111   targetHomContrast=0.66
00112 ){
00113         subsetIndex<-chooseSubset(contrast,nSubset)
00114         myData.full<-buildFrame(contrast,size,len_nsp,len_sty)
00115 
00116     myData.subset <- myData.full[subsetIndex,]
00117 
00118         EMnorm<-EMContrast(myData.subset,max_iterations,log_lik_convergence)
00119         # converged, work with full data again
00120 
00121         contrast.new<-predictNorm(myData,EMnorm)
00122   return(list(
00123     contrast=contrast.new,
00124     fit1=EMnorm$fit1,
00125     fit2=EMnorm$fit2,
00126     fit3=EMnorm$fit3,
00127         sigma<-EMnorm$sigma,
00128     n_iterations=EMnorm$n_iterations,
00129   ))
00130 }
